// TypeScript Version: 4.1

/// <reference types="@stdlib/types"/>

import * as random from '@stdlib/types/random';
import { Collection } from '@stdlib/types/array';

/**
* Interface defining function options.
*/
interface Options {
	/**
	* Pseudorandom number generator which generates uniformly distributed pseudorandom numbers.
	*/
	prng?: random.PRNG;

	/**
	* Pseudorandom number generator seed.
	*/
	seed?: random.PRNGSeedMT19937;

	/**
	* Pseudorandom number generator state.
	*/
	state?: random.PRNGStateMT19937;

	/**
	* Specifies whether to copy a provided pseudorandom number generator state (default: `true`).
	*/
	copy?: boolean;
}

/**
* Interface for PRNG properties and methods.
*/
interface PRNG {
	/**
	* Underlying pseudorandom number generator.
	*/
	readonly PRNG: random.PRNG;

	/**
	* PRNG seed.
	*/
	readonly seed: random.PRNGSeedMT19937 | null;

	/**
	* PRNG seed length.
	*/
	readonly seedLength: number | null;

	/**
	* PRNG state.
	*/
	state: random.PRNGStateMT19937 | null;

	/**
	* PRNG state length.
	*/
	readonly stateLength: number | null;

	/**
	* PRNG state size (in bytes).
	*/
	readonly byteLength: number | null;
}

/**
* Interface for filling strided arrays with pseudorandom numbers drawn from {{FROM_DESC}}.
*/
interface Random extends PRNG {
	/**
	* Fills a strided array with pseudorandom numbers drawn from {{FROM_DESC}}.
	*
	* @param N - number of indexed elements
	* @param {{PARAM_1}} - {{PARAM_1_DESC}}
	* @param {{PARAM_1_STRIDE}} - `{{PARAM_1}}` strided length
	* @param out - output array
	* @param so - `out` stride length
	* @returns output array
	*
	* @example
	* var Float64Array = require( '@stdlib/array/float64' );
	*
	* // Create an array:
	* var out = new Float64Array( 10 );
	*
	* // Fill the array with pseudorandom numbers:
	* {{ALIAS}}( out.length, [ {{PARAM_1_VALUE}} ], 0, out, 1 );
	*/
	<T = unknown>( N: number, {{PARAM_1}}: Collection<{{PARAM_1_DTYPE}}>, {{PARAM_1_STRIDE}}: number, out: Collection<T>, so: number ): Collection<T | number>;

	/**
	* Fills a strided array with pseudorandom numbers drawn from {{FROM_DESC}} using alternative indexing semantics.
	*
	* @param N - number of indexed elements
	* @param {{PARAM_1}} - {{PARAM_1_DESC}}
	* @param {{PARAM_1_STRIDE}} - `{{PARAM_1}}` strided length
	* @param {{PARAM_1_OFFSET}} - starting index for `{{PARAM_1}}`
	* @param out - output array
	* @param so - `out` stride length
	* @param oo - starting index for `out`
	* @returns output array
	*
	* @example
	* var Float64Array = require( '@stdlib/array/float64' );
	*
	* // Create an array:
	* var out = new Float64Array( 10 );
	*
	* // Fill the array with pseudorandom numbers:
	* {{ALIAS}}.ndarray( out.length, [ {{PARAM_1_VALUE}} ], 0, 0, out, 1, 0 );
	*/
	ndarray<T = unknown>( N: number, {{PARAM_1}}: Collection<{{PARAM_1_DTYPE}}>, {{PARAM_1_STRIDE}}: number, {{PARAM_1_OFFSET}}: number, out: Collection<T>, so: number, oo: number ): Collection<T | number>;
}

/**
* Interface describing the main export.
*/
interface Routine extends Random {
	/**
	* Returns a function for filling strided arrays with pseudorandom numbers drawn from {{FROM_DESC}}.
	*
	* @param options - function options
	* @throws must provide a valid state
	* @returns function for filling strided arrays
	*
	* @example
	* var Float64Array = require( '@stdlib/array/float64' );
	*
	* // Create a new PRNG function:
	* var random = {{ALIAS}}.factory();
	*
	* // Create an array:
	* var out = new Float64Array( 10 );
	*
	* // Fill the array with pseudorandom numbers:
	* random( out.length, [ {{PARAM_1_VALUE}} ], 0, out, 1 );
	*
	* @example
	* var Float64Array = require( '@stdlib/array/float64' );
	*
	* // Create a new PRNG function:
	* var random = {{ALIAS}}.factory({
	*     'seed': 297
	* });
	*
	* // Create an array:
	* var out = new Float64Array( 10 );
	*
	* // Fill the array with pseudorandom numbers:
	* random( out.length, [ {{PARAM_1_VALUE}} ], 0, out, 1 );
	*/
	factory( options?: Options ): Random;
}

/**
* Fills a strided array with pseudorandom numbers drawn from {{FROM_DESC}}.
*
* @param N - number of indexed elements
* @param {{PARAM_1}} - {{PARAM_1_DESC}}
* @param {{PARAM_1_STRIDE}} - `{{PARAM_1}}` stride length
* @param out - output array
* @param so - `out` stride length
* @returns output array
*
* @example
* var Float64Array = require( '@stdlib/array/float64' );
*
* // Create an array:
* var out = new Float64Array( 10 );
*
* // Fill the array with pseudorandom numbers:
* {{ALIAS}}( out.length, [ {{PARAM_1_VALUE}} ], 0, out, 1 );
*
* @example
* var Float64Array = require( '@stdlib/array/float64' );
*
* // Create an array:
* var out = new Float64Array( 10 );
*
* // Fill the array with pseudorandom numbers:
* {{ALIAS}}.ndarray( out.length, [ {{PARAM_1_VALUE}} ], 0, 0, out, 1, 0 );
*/
declare var {{ALIAS}}: Routine;


// EXPORTS //

export = {{ALIAS}};
